1{-# LANGUAGE TupleSections #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Type for types.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Type.Type
7  ( -- * Type
8    Type (..),
9    NamedType,
10    typeExplain,
11    typeTermMix,
12
13    -- * Utility
14    -- ** Construct
15    typeFlatRel,
16    typeConsRel,
17    typeConsNest,
18    typeAppendRel,
19
20    -- ** Select
21    typeRelTermNames,
22    typeRelDegree,
23    typeTerms,
24    isTypeRel,
25    typeRelIndex,
26    --typeRelIndexList,
27
28    -- ** Modify
29    typeRelMapTerms,
30    typeRelMapTerm,
31    typeRelMapName,
32
33    -- $Types
34  ) where
35
36import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture          as O
37import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base              as B
38import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax            as S
39import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Type.Judge        as T
40
41-- | Type for types.
42data Type
43    = TypeAny                     -- ^ Everything
44    | TypeType                    -- ^ Type of types
45    | TypeTerm                    -- ^ Term name
46    | TypeInterp                  -- ^ Data interpreation
47
48    | TypeEmpty                   -- ^ Empty
49    | TypeEnd                     -- ^ End
50    | TypeBool                    -- ^ Boolean
51    | TypeText                    -- ^ Text
52    | TypeCode                    -- ^ Code
53    | TypeDec                     -- ^ Decimal
54    | TypeClock   (Maybe String)  -- ^ Clock
55    | TypeTime    (Maybe String)  -- ^ Time
56    | TypeBin                     -- ^ Binary data
57
58    | TypeList    Type            -- ^ List
59    | TypeSet     Type            -- ^ Set
60    | TypeTag     String Type     -- ^ Tagged type
61    | TypeTie     [S.Term Type]   -- ^ Tie
62    | TypeRel     [S.Term Type]   -- ^ Relation
63
64    | TypeTuple   [Type]          -- ^ Tuple (Product type)
65    | TypeSum     [Type]          -- ^ Sum type
66      deriving (Show, Eq, Ord)
67
68-- | Term type, i.e., term name and type of its content.
69type NamedType = B.Named Type
70
71instance B.MixEncode Type where
72    mixEncode = typeToMix
73
74typeToMix :: Type -> B.MixText
75typeToMix = wf where
76    wf = w False    -- no parens
77    wt = w True     -- with parens
78
79    w _ TypeAny                = B.mix "any"
80    w _ TypeEmpty              = B.mix "empty"
81    w _ TypeEnd                = B.mix "end"
82    w _ TypeBool               = B.mix "boolean"
83    w _ TypeText               = B.mix "text"
84    w _ TypeCode               = B.mix "code"
85    w _ TypeDec                = B.mix "decimal"
86    w _ (TypeClock (Nothing))  = B.mix "clock"
87    w _ (TypeClock (Just p))   = B.mix "clock" `B.mixSep` B.mix p
88    w _ (TypeTime (Nothing))   = B.mix "time"
89    w _ (TypeTime (Just p))    = B.mix "time"  `B.mixSep` B.mix p
90    w _ TypeBin                = B.mix "binary"
91    w _ TypeTerm               = B.mix "term"
92    w _ TypeType               = B.mix "type"
93    w _ TypeInterp             = B.mix "interp"
94
95    w _ (TypeList    t)        = B.mix "list" `B.mixSep` wt t
96    w _ (TypeSet     t)        = B.mix "set"  `B.mixSep` wt t
97    w _ (TypeTag tag t)        = B.mix "tag"  `B.mixSep` (B.mix tag O.++ B.mix ":")
98                                              `B.mixSep` wt t
99
100    w q (TypeTie    ts)        = wrap q (B.mix "tie" `B.mixSep` termTypes ts)
101    w q (TypeRel    ts)        = wrap q (B.mix "rel" `B.mixSep` termTypes ts)
102    w _ (TypeTuple  ts)        = B.mix "tuple" `B.mixSep` (B.mixJoin1 $ map wt ts)
103    w q (TypeSum ts)           = wrap q (B.mixJoinBar $ map wf ts)
104
105    wrap :: Bool -> B.MixText -> B.MixText
106    wrap False xs              = xs
107    wrap True  xs              = S.bracketWith S.bracketGroup xs
108
109    termTypes = B.mixJoin1 . map termType
110
111    termType :: S.Term Type -> B.MixText
112    termType (n, t) = T.termNameToMix n `B.mixSep` wt t
113
114-- | Print type as tree.
115typeExplain :: Type -> B.Doc
116typeExplain ty =
117    case ty of
118      TypeList     t  -> B.pprint "list"   B.<+> typeExplain t
119      TypeSet      t  -> B.pprint "set"    B.<+> typeExplain t
120      TypeTag  tag t  -> B.pprint "tag"    B.<+> B.pprint (tag ++ ":") B.<+> typeExplain t
121      TypeTie     ts  -> B.pprint "tie"    B.<+> vmap term ts
122      TypeRel     ts  -> B.pprint "rel"    B.<+> vmap term ts
123      TypeTuple   ts  -> B.pprint "tuple"  B.<+> vmap (item ":") ts
124      TypeSum     ts  -> B.pprint "sum"    B.<+> vmap (item "|") ts
125      _               -> B.pprint $ B.mixToFlatString $ B.mixEncode ty
126    where
127      term (n,t)  =  B.pprint (S.termNameString n) B.<+> typeExplain t
128      item i t    =  B.pprint i B.<+> typeExplain t
129      vmap f      =  B.pprintV . map f
130
131-- | Encode term types.
132typeTermMix :: Type -> B.MixText
133typeTermMix (TypeRel ts) = B.mixJoin1 $ map name ts where
134    name (n, _) = B.mix $ S.termNameChars n
135typeTermMix _ = B.mixEmpty
136
137
138-- --------------------------------------------  Relation utilities
139
140-- ----------------------  Construct
141
142-- | Create relation type from term names.
143typeFlatRel :: [S.TermName] -> Type
144typeFlatRel ns = TypeRel $ map term ns where
145    term n = (n, TypeAny)
146
147-- | Add term name to relation type.
148typeConsRel :: S.TermName -> O.Map Type
149typeConsRel n = typeConsNest n TypeAny
150
151-- | Add term name and type to relation type.
152typeConsNest :: S.TermName -> Type -> O.Map Type
153typeConsNest n t (TypeRel ts) = TypeRel $ (n, t) : ts
154typeConsNest _ _ t = t
155
156-- | Add term names to relation type.
157typeAppendRel :: [S.TermName] -> O.Map Type
158typeAppendRel ns (TypeRel ts) = TypeRel $ map (, TypeAny) ns ++ ts where
159typeAppendRel _ t = t
160
161-- ----------------------  Select
162
163-- | Get term names from relation type.
164typeRelTermNames :: Type -> [S.TermName]
165typeRelTermNames (TypeRel ts) = map fst ts
166typeRelTermNames _ = []
167
168-- | Get degree of relation type.
169typeRelDegree :: Type -> Int
170typeRelDegree (TypeRel ts) = length ts
171typeRelDegree _ = 0
172
173-- | Get named type from relation type or tie type.
174typeTerms :: Type -> [S.Term Type]
175typeTerms (TypeRel ts) = ts
176typeTerms (TypeTie ts) = ts
177typeTerms _            = []
178
179-- | Test type is relational.
180isTypeRel :: Type -> Bool
181isTypeRel (TypeRel _)  = True
182isTypeRel _            = False
183
184-- ----------------------  Index
185
186-- | Calculate term index.
187--
188--   >>> typeRelIndex (typeFlatRel ["a", "b", "c"]) ["b"]
189--   [1]
190--
191--   >>> typeRelIndex (typeFlatRel ["a", "b", "c"]) ["e"]
192--   [-1]
193--
194--   >>> typeRelIndex (typeConsNest "r" (typeFlatRel ["a", "b"]) (typeFlatRel [])) ["r", "b"]
195--   [0, 1]
196--
197typeRelIndex :: Type -> S.TermPath -> [Int]
198typeRelIndex (TypeRel ts) p = loop ts p 0 where
199    loop _ [] _ = []
200    loop [] _ _ = [-1]
201    loop ((n1, TypeRel ts') : ts2) nns@(n2 : ns) i
202        | n1 == n2  = i : loop ts' ns 0
203        | otherwise = loop ts2 nns (i + 1)
204    loop ((n1, _) : ts2) nns@(n2 : _) i
205        | n1 == n2  = [i]
206        | otherwise = loop ts2 nns (i + 1)
207typeRelIndex _ _ = []
208
209-- typeRelIndexList :: Type -> [S.TermPath] -> [[Int]]
210-- typeRelIndexList = map . typeRelIndex
211
212-- ----------------------  Modify
213
214-- | Modify terms of relation type.
215typeRelMapTerms :: O.Map [S.Term Type] -> O.Map Type
216typeRelMapTerms f (TypeRel ts) = TypeRel $ f ts
217typeRelMapTerms _ t = t
218
219-- | Modify term of relation type.
220typeRelMapTerm :: O.Map (S.Term Type) -> O.Map Type
221typeRelMapTerm f t = typeRelMapTerms (map f) t
222
223-- | Modify term name of relation type.
224typeRelMapName :: O.Map S.TermName -> O.Map Type
225typeRelMapName = typeRelMapTerm . B.mapFst
226
227
228
229-- ------------------------------------------------------------------
230-- $Types
231--
232--  [Empty]     Empty means that there are no values.
233--              i.e., universal negation on the term holds.
234--              Textual form is the non-quoted parens: @()@.
235--
236--  [Boolean]   Boolean used for something is hold or unhold.
237--              Textual forms: @\<0\>@ (false), @\<1\>@ (true).
238--
239--  [Text]      Sequence of characters.
240--              Textual forms is chars with apostrophe or
241--              doubly-quoted line: @\'abc@, @\"abc def\"@.
242--
243--  [Decimal]   Decimal number.
244--              Textual forms is sequence of digits:
245--              @100@, @99.50@, @hex AF@.
246--
247--  [Set]       Set is an unordered collection of contents.
248--              Duplication among contents is not significant.
249--              Textual form is a sequence of contents
250--              delimited by colon, enclosed in braces:
251--              @{ \'a | \'b | \'c }@.
252--
253--  [List]      List is an ordered list of contents.
254--              Textual form is a sequence of contents
255--              delimited by colon, enclosed in square brackets:
256--              @[ \'abc | \'def ]@.
257--
258--  [Tie]       Tie is an bundle of terms,
259--              i.e., a list of named contents.
260--              Textual form is a sequence of terms
261--              with hyphen-braces: @{- \/a 10 \/b 20 -}@.
262--
263--  [Relation]  Relation is a set of same-type tuples,
264--              Textual form is a sequence of tuples
265--              enclosed in equal-braces.
266--              The first tuple is a heading of relation,
267--              and succeeding tuples are delimited by vertical bar:
268--              @{= \/a \/b [ \'A1 | 20 ][ \'A3 | 40 ] =}@.
269--
